title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-2.7 - Hearings

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-2.7 - Hearings

State Regulations
(a) Hearings shall
be conducted as provided in Subpart 8187-1 of this Part. The State Board may
examine and inquire into the equalization complained of and the hearing officer
may receive in evidence from ORPTS, evidence, documentary or otherwise, including statistical and other data in possession of ORPTS relevant to the
correctness of the county equalization under review. (b) The complainant shall have the burden of
proof of proving that the equalization is unfair and inequitable. (c) Where the equalization rates established
by the county are the same as the latest State equalization rates or special
equalization rates, evidence submitted at the hearing as to whether the
equalization under review is fair and equitable shall be limited to the
statistical, sampling and appraisal methodologies, used in making the
equalization and shall not include evidence as to the valuation of specific
parcels of real property. Notes
